wikipedia_page.main: Edwyn Sherard Burnaby (22 May 1830 – 31 May 1883) was a major-general and Conservative Party Member of Parliament (MP) for Leicestershire North from 1880 until his death. He served in the Crimean War.

response: A descendant of Andrew Burnaby (1732–1812), who had married the heiress of the Edwyn family of Baggrave,Bernard Burke, A Genealogical and Heraldic History of the Landed Gentry of Great Britain (Burke Publishing Company, 1921), pp. 241–242: "BURNABY OF BAGGRAVE HALL, ALGERNON EDWYN BURNABY, of Baggrave Hall, co. Leicester, J.P., Major Terr. Force Reserve, late Lieut Royal Horse Guards and Capt. Westmorland and Cumberland Yeomanry" Burnaby was born in the parish of St George Hanover Square, Westminster,"Burnaby Algernon Edwyn" in Register of Births for St George Hanover Square Registration District vol. 1a (1868), p. 319 the son of Major-General Edwyn Sherard Burnaby, who went on to become a member of parliament, and of his wife Louisa Julia Mary Dixie, daughter of Sir Willoughby Wolstan Dixie, 8th Baronet. He had an older sister, Hilda Louisa. Their mother died in 1881, and their father in 1883, when Burnaby was fifteen, and he thus inherited the Baggrave estate in Leicestershire as a minor.Burke's Peerage vol. 1 (2003), p. 1073 Edwyn Burnaby's land agent, William Beeson, was sole executor of his will.BURNABY Edwyn Sherard in Probate Calendar for 1883 Burnaby was educated at Eton College.
